Class.name: PApplet
Class.span: Represents an interactive animation that runs in the Pygame window; modelled on Processing’s PApplet class.

Method.name: PApplet(setup, draw, eventMap)
Method.span: The constructor creates a Sketch instance from a setup function. Use the run method to run the sketch.
Method.Arg: An unbound function that initializes the sketch. A reference to the sketch.

Class.Method: Returns the default edge behaviour for new sprites.

Set the sketch background. An image to be used for the sketch background. The sketch aspect ratio will be locked (except when maximized) to match the background image. A color to be drawn as the background. If both arguments are given, the image will be blitted onto a background of the specified color. Require the image to be scaled even if it matches the sketch size; this allows drawing on the background without affecting the original.
Redraws the background and all visible sprites.

Specifies a new drawing function and event map to control the animation. An unbound function that draws one frame of the animation. A reference to the sketch.
A dictionary that maps event types or classes (keys) to handler functions (values). You can use None as a key to specify a handler for events that do not have a custom handler.

PropA.name: wall
PropA.span: Assign a color to this property to create a wall around the sketch. Call the setBackground method after setting the wall color to draw the wall. This property affects the default edge behaviour of sprites.

PropR.name: frameNumber
PropR.span: The number of frames that have been drawn (including the current frame) since the animate method was last called.

PropR.name: draw
PropR.span: A reference to the current drawing function. Use the animate method to change the drawing function.

PropR.name: eventMap
PropR.span: A dictionary that maps events types (keys) to handler functions (values). Use the animate method to change the event map.

PropR.name: io
PropR.span: A reference to the GUI dialog object created by the prompt or fileDialog methods. Will be None when no such dialog is running.
